net.sourceforge.nite.tools.videolabeler
Class AnnotationFrame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JInternalFrame
                  net.sourceforge.nite.tools.videolabeler.AnnotationFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class AnnotationFrame
extends javax.swing.JInternalFrame

An annotation frame consists of two or three parts: an annotation area at the top (only if showAnnotationArea of the specified annotation layer is true), an annotation control panel in the middle and a target control panel at the bottom. These two or three parts are separated by splitters. This class creates the components of the annotation frame for the annotations of an agent and layer. The three parts are connected through the annotation listener and annotation selection listener interfaces.

When the annotation frame is hidden or if the annotation area is hidden (using the splitter), the frame will call setVisible(false) on the hidden frame components, so the components can handle that event.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

AnnotationFrame

public AnnotationFrame(NAgent agent,
                       AnnotationLayer layer)
                throws java.lang.Exception

Constructs a new annotation frame for the specified layer and agent. The agent parameter may be null if the layer belongs to an interaction coding rather than an agent coding.

Parameters:
agent - an agent (if the layer belongs to an agent coding) or null (if the layer belongs to an interaction coding)
layer - an annotation layer
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the target control panel could not be created

getAnnotationAgent

public NAgent getAnnotationAgent()

Returns the agent of this annotation frame. If the annotation layer belongs to an interaction coding, this method returns null.

Returns:
the agent of this annotation frame or null

getAnnotationArea

public AnnotationArea getAnnotationArea()

Returns the annotation area of this frame. If the annotation layer says that the annotation area should not be shown, this method will return null.

Returns:
the annotation area or null

getAnnotationControlPanel

public AnnotationControlPanel getAnnotationControlPanel()

Returns the annotation control panel of this frame.

Returns:
the annotation control panel

getTargetControlPanel

public TargetControlPanel getTargetControlPanel()

Returns the target control panel. If an error occurred while creating the target control panel, this method will return null.

Returns:
the target control panel or null

getAnnotationLayer

public AnnotationLayer getAnnotationLayer()

Returns the layer of this annotation frame.

Returns:
the layer of this annotation frame
